thread.title: Festival of Champions prepares for 14th running
thread.title_full: Festival of Champions prepares for 14th running

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Festival of Champions prepares for 14th running
text:
Festival of Champions prepares for 14th running More than 70 high schools, 1,700 runners to participate in jam-packed event By Staff | Oct 01, 2015 
Belfast — Runners from 67 Maine high schools as well as others from Rhode island, Vermont, New Hampshire and Prince Edward Island — totaling more than 1,700 student-athletes — will converge on Troy Howard Middle School on Saturday, Oct. 3 to participate in the 14th annual Maine Cross-Country Festival of Champions. 
The largest sporting event in the state is a preview of sorts for the upcoming conference, regional and state championship meets, which highlights standout individuals and championship teams from schools large and small. 
The event is set to begin at 11 a.m with the first wave of six races. 
The order of races for the day include — Girls unseeded section, 11 a.m.; boys unseeded section, 11:45 a.m.; girls freshmen section, 12:30 p.m.; boys freshmen section, 1:15 p.m.; girls seeded race, 2 p.m.; and boys seeded race, 2:40 p.m. 
The award ceremony is set to begin at about 3:20 p.m. 
The event is co-hosted by Belfast and Brewer. 
Maine teams that will be represented will be Belfast, Bangor, Brunswick, Biddeford, Bonny Eagle of Standish, Boothbay, Brewer, Bucksport, Camden Hills of Rockport, Cape Elizabeth, Caribou, Cheverus of Portland, Cony of Augusta, Dirigo of Dixfield, Edward Little of Auburn, Ellsworth, Falmouth, Foxcroft Academy, George Stevens Academy of Blue Hill, Gould Academy of Bethel, Gray-New Gloucester, Hall-Dale of Farmingdale, Hampden Academy, Hermon, Houlton, John Bapst of Bangor, Kents Hill, Lake Region of Belgrade, Lawrence of Fairfield, Leavitt of Turner, Lewiston, Lincoln Academy of Newcastle, Madison, Maine Central Institute of Pittsfield, Maranacook of Readfield, Marshwood of South Berwick, Massabesic of Waterboro, Mattanawcook Academy of Lincoln, Medomak Valley of Waldoboro, Messalonskee of Oakland, Monmouth Academy, Morse of Bath, Mt. Blue of Farmington, Mount Desert Island of Bar Harbor, Mountain Valley of Rumford, Nokomis of Newport, North Yarmouth Academy, Oceanside of Rockland/Thomaston, Old Town, Orono, Oxford Hills of South Paris, Presque Isle, Richmond, Saint Dominic Academy of Auburn, Scarborough, South Portland, Telstar of Bethel, Thornton Academy of Saco, Waterville, Westbrook, Windham, Winslow, Winthrop and York. 
Three schools from Rhode Island and one from Vermont, New Hamshire and Prince Edward Island also will take part in the event. 
McKee Billings Attorneys of Augusta has partnered with the Festival of Champions as a corporate sponsor for this year's event. Attorney Walter McKee is an avid runner and has enjoyed the meet both as a parent and spectator. 
“We are proud to be a supporter of Maine's largest high school sporting event,” he said. “It is an incredible event.”
